films.title: Brendan Fraser in Conversation
films.description: Academy Award winner Brendan Fraser discusses his career so far and his role in HIKARI's Rental Family.

films.title: Channel 4’s powerful documentary.
films.description: MEMBER EXCLUSIVES These events are exclusive to BFI Members and their guests. Make the most of your Membership benefits at bfi.org.uk/members All Member exclusive tickets are just £8 unless otherwise stated. Patrons and Members can book as soon as their priority booking opens and tickets will be allocated on a first- come, first-served basis. Remaining tickets will be released to the public, as a taster of the benefits of Membership, once public booking opens. Member Picks For a chance to see on

films.title: Gilbert & George: 21st Century Pictures is showing at the Hayward Gallery untill
films.description: 11 Jan 2026 Blake’s 7: Redemption & Star One + Q&A with actor

films.title: HTM Television/ITV 2025. Director Jamie Donoghue. With Vicky McClure,
films.description: Vicky McClure’s Lana Washington returns with her team of bomb disposal experts for the preview of the incendiary opening episode of the third series.

films.title: Laura Mulvey in Conversation
films.description: sharing thoughts about her relationship with cinema and why film can be a dynamic, multi-layered form to think through. BSL This event will have live captions and a BSL interpreter

films.title: Lust for Life + intro by Christopher Frayling
films.description: Kirk Douglas portrays Vincent Van Gogh in Vincente Minnelli's gloriously colourful and critically acclaimed biopic. Christopher Frayling will be signing copies of his new book 'The Hollywood History of Art' (Reel Art Press) at 17:30 outside the BFI Reuben Library Mark Kermode Live in 3D at the BFI The critic presents the latest episode of his live discussion, on stage in NFT1.
films.cast: Kirk Douglas, Anthony Quinn, Pamela Brown

films.title: Preview: Is This Thing On?
films.cast: Will Arnett, Laura Dern, Andra Day

films.title: Preview: Rental Family
films.cast: Brendan Fraser, Takehiro Hira, Mari Yamamoto

films.title: Reece Shearsmith Presents Gremlins + intro by Reece Shearsmith
films.description: Joe Dante's darkly comic Christmas tale, an instant cult favourite, sees otherworldly creatures run amok in smalltown America.
films.cast: Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton

films.title: Screen Two Symposium
films.description: A series of lectures and discussions highlighting the importance and legacy of this landmark BBC strand. An event co-hosted by the BFI and the Centre for the History of Television Culture and Production, Royal Holloway (in association with the AHRC-funded Screen Two research project)

films.title: Supermarionation Memories – In Conversation with Dee Anderson
films.description: The daughter of Thunderbirds creators Gerry and Sylvia Anderson presents an immersive dive into her parent's extraordinary creative world.

films.title: Terry Jones: The Renaissance Man
films.description: This event comprises rare and memorable clips highlighting the talents of Terry Jones, with on-stage contributions from his friends, family and colleagues. BSL This event will have live captions and a BSL interpreter Mark Kermode Live in 3D at the BFI The critic presents the latest episode of his live discussion, on stage in NFT1. SuperBob 10th Anniversary + Q&A with writer and actor

films.title: The Inertia Variations + Q&A with Matt Johnson and director Johanna St Michaels
films.description: We screen this rarely seen documentary about The The's Matt Johnson, followed by an interview with the singer-songwriter.

films.title: TV Preview: An Evening With Radio Times – Run Away + Q&A with cast and creator TBC
films.description: This riveting adaptation of Harlan Coben's thriller finds a family torn apart by absence, addiction and crime.
films.cast: James Nesbitt, Ruth Jones, Minnie Driver

films.title: TV Preview: Black Ops + Q&A with cast and creator TBC
films.description: We preview episodes from the second series of this hugely popular show.
films.cast: Gbemisola Ikumelo, Hammed Animashaun, Akemnji Ndifornyen

films.title: TV Preview: The Room in the Tower + Q&A with director Mark Gatiss and members of the cast
films.description: Mark Gatiss returns with another chilling ghost story at Christmas.

films.title: Will Arnett in Conversation
films.description: Will Arnett discusses his career to date and talks about his collaboration with director Bradley Cooper on his latest film, Is This Thing On?
